Package com.milav.jaguar.user

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.milav.jaguar.user.UserController
@Service public class UserController extends Object
The class is the controller that manages methods that have to do with users.
Author:
Milav Shah, Jigar Shah

  • Method Details

    • createUserInDB

      public void createUserInDB(String firstName, String lastName, @NotNull @NotNull String email, @NotNull @NotNull String password, @NotNull @NotNull String salt)
      The method creates an entry in the database with the given information.
      Parameters:
      firstName - first name of the user.
      lastName - last name of the user.
      email - email of the user.
      password - user's password.
      salt - sprinkle the salt to make password guessing hard

    • doesUserExist

      public boolean doesUserExist(@NotNull @NotNull String email)
      The method finds a user given an email. It is assumed that each user has a unique email address. You cannot have multiple users with the same email address.
      Parameters:
      email - the search query
      Returns:
      boolean

    • findUser

      public User findUser(@NotNull @NotNull String email) throws DBException
      The method finds a user given an email address.

      It returns a User object with prefilled data retrieved from the database. The user can be null if the user does not exist in the database.

      Parameters:
      email - the search query to match against the database.
      Returns:
      User
      Throws:
      DBException - we have to connect to the database to find the user.

    • updateUserInDB

      public User updateUserInDB(@NotNull @NotNull User oldInfo, String firstname, String lastname, String email, String password, String salt)
      The method finds a user in the database and edits the entry.
      Parameters:
      oldInfo - the user's old information
      firstname - the user's new first name
      lastname - the user's new last name
      email - the user's new email
      password - the user's new password
      Returns:
      User

    • deleteUserFromDB

      public void deleteUserFromDB(String email)
      Deletes the user from the database.
      Parameters:
      email - the search query.
